Rest

Sunday, November 20, 2022

Simmering down is a challenge this week. I wake, daily before 6am, and jump straight into the day. My jump doesnâ€™t land me in a FOMO-inducing Instagram feed or a busy news site, but on a blank screen that waits eagerly as I type my 1,000 words of the morning. Itâ€™s another one of the Habits I picked up this autumn. Me, the darkness outside, and a soft light in the living room acquainting me with the day. Itâ€™s pleasing to meet myself, unfiltered.

Itâ€™s also one of the few moments of solitude and focus I allow myself this week, apparently. Now that Iâ€™m beginning to reintegrate back into work at [[ Public/_notes/Leeruniek ]], I seem to have forgotten how much down time my body still requires. Iâ€™ve received a work assignment, on which Iâ€™ll get to work independently, and Iâ€™m excited. Curious. Hungry. On the cusp of small-scale overdrive. I had to stop working precisely because of this.

Itâ€™s boring.

Then I remember and old way to find calm and relaxation. The voices of Josh Clark and Chuck Bryant, telling me about stuff I should know.

Whatâ€™s top of mind right now

  • Saw Hannah Gadsbyâ€™s Body of Work and had a brief, cogent crush on her
